references.paper_title: Mean-Field Langevin Dynamics: Exponential Convergence and Annealing
references.reason: This paper provides the core theoretical foundation for mean-field Langevin dynamics (MFLD), a key concept in the current work.
This book provides the foundational geometric concepts that are essential for the understanding of the mathematical framework of MFLD.

references.paper_title: Analysis and geometry of Markov diffusion operators
references.reason: This book establishes the theory of logarithmic Sobolev inequalities and displacement convexity, which are fundamental for proving convergence rates of MFLD.

references.paper_title: Optimal entropy-transport problems and a new Hellinger-Kantorovich distance between positive measures
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of optimal entropy-transport problems, which are closely related to the lifting reduction used in this work to extend MFLD to signed measures.

references.paper_title: Mean-field Langevin dynamics: Time-space discretization, stochastic gradient, and variance reduction
references.reason: This paper provides refined computational guarantees for fully discrete MFLD, which are important for practical applications and are extended in this work to the bilevel approach.
